title: Under Armour climbs after founder Kevin Plank steps down as CEO (UA)
text:
AP/Nick Wass

Under Armour announced on Tuesday that CEO Kevin Plank would step down and that Chief Operating Officer Patrik Frisk would replace him in the top spot on January 1.

Shares of Under Armour gained as much as 3% on the news.

The leadership change comes as the company tries to reinvent itself as a leading sportswear brand.

Watch Under Armour trade live on Markets Insider.

There will soon be a new leader at Under Armour. After 23 years leading the company he founded in his grandmother's basement, CEO Kevin Plank is stepping down.

Shares of the sportswear company gained as much as 3% in early trading Tuesday after it announced that Patrik Frisk, its president and chief operating officer, would be its next CEO.

Frisk will take over the position on January 1, when Plank will become the executive chairman and brand chief, Under Armour said in a press release.

Before joining Under Armour in 2017, Frisk held multiple leadership positions in his 30 years of experience in the apparel, footwear, and retail industry. He was most recently the CEO of the Aldo Group.

"I joined Under Armour to be part of an iconic brand that demonstrated the power of sport and premium experience, when properly harnessed, is capable of unlimited possibilities," Frisk said in the press release. "Today, I am even more resolute in this conviction."

He continued: "The opportunity that lies ahead of us is incredible. As our entire global team continues to lean hard into our transformation, I am honored to lead this great brand toward the realization of its full potential."

The leadership change comes amid a transformation for Under Armour as it switches from offense to defense, looking to stay relevant in an ever changing retail landscape. The company announced a turnaround in 2018 but has yet to realize consistent gains.

In July, shares slid 13% after Under Armour's second-quarter earnings report outlined flat sales in North America, a key region and one that is under Frisk 's leadership, CNBC reported.

Under Armour was up 12% year-to-date through Monday.
